author: By Robert Farley
title: "In April, Sen. McCain came out against helping women earn equal pay for equal work."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: McCain is "selectively editing Joe Biden's words...Biden actually said about Barack Obama: 'They're gonna find out this guy's got steel in his spine.'"

author: By Bill Adair
title: "Obama says Iran is a 'tiny' country, 'doesn't pose a serious threat.'"

author: By Robert Farley
title: "Barack Obama has consistently voted against tougher penalties for criminals."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: John McCain's health care plan "won't guarantee coverage of cancer screenings or maternity care."

author: By Robert Farley
title: "One percent of the American people make over 21 percent of all the income in America. That wasn’t the way before George Bush became president."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: If parents "don't have health insurance that Senator Obama wants them to have (for their children), they will be fined."

author: By Bill Adair
title: Says Obama wants to redesign the American flag "to better offer our enemies hope and love."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "Barack Obama's plan gives a driver's license to any illegal who wants one."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: Barack Obama will "raise Social Security taxes."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "Barack Obama thinks terrorists just need a good talking to."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: On supporting the Supreme Court abortion decision Roe v. Wade

author: By Robert Farley
title: On which team he's rooting for in the World Series.

author: By Bill Adair
title: "Sen. Obama's campaign announced that he's choosing his cabinet."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: Between 40 and 50 percent of tax filers do not owe any income tax.

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: Barack Obama was "a trial attorney for ACORN."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "If Barack Obama would apply for a job with the FBI or with the Secret Service, he would be disqualified because of his past associations with William Ayers."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: In 1992, Barack Obama directed "Project Vote - an arm of ACORN that also encouraged voter registration."

author: By Robert Farley
title: Medicare spends "$15-billion a year on subsidies to insurance companies."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "The centerpiece of Senator McCain's education policy is to increase the voucher program in D.C. by 2,000 slots."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: "98 percent of small businesses make less than $250,000" and would not see a tax increase under Barack Obama's plan.

author: By David DeCamp
title: "He voted twice for a budget resolution that increases the taxes on individuals making $42,000 a year."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "Obama said he would unilaterally renegotiate the North American Free Trade Agreement."

author: By David DeCamp
title: "Congressman John Lewis, an American hero, made allegations that Sarah Palin and I were somehow associated with ... the worst chapter in American history. ... And, Senator Obama, you didn't repudiate those remarks."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: If you're a small business and don't "adopt the health care plan that Senator Obama mandates, he's going to fine you."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: Under John McCain's health care plan, people get a $5,000 tax credit to buy a $12,000 health care policy, and "that's a loss for you."

author: By Adriel Bettelheim
title: "AIG executives ... (took) a junket for over $400,000. Twice."

author: By Robert Farley
title: "The truth was revealed there in that report that showed there was no unlawful or unethical activity on my part."

author: By Robert Farley
title: On the economic crisis, "the biggest problem in this whole process was the deregulation of the financial system."

author: By Robert Farley
title: "I wrote to Secretary Paulson, I wrote to Federal Reserve Chairman Bernanke [in March 2007], and told them this is something we have to deal with, and nobody did anything about it."

author: By Robert Farley
title: On the economic troubles of 2008, "really the match that lit this fire was Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac."

author: By Robert Farley
title: "The Democrats in the Senate and some members of Congress defended what Fannie and Freddie were doing. They resisted any change."

author: By David DeCamp
title: Obama "voted for ... $3-million for an overhead projector at a planetarium in Chicago."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "(Bill) Ayers and Obama ran a radical education foundation together."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: Barack Obama voted against "born alive" legislation in Illinois that was "virtually identical to the federal law."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: Under Barack Obama's health care proposal, "if you've got a health care plan that you like, you can keep it."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: Barack Obama opposed a bill that would have saved Gianna Jessen's life.

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: "I want to give every American a $5,000 refundable tax credit."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: John McCain accused Barack Obama "of letting infants die."

author: By Robert Farley
title: A mortgage buyback plan is "my proposal, it's not Sen. Obama's proposal, it's not President Bush's proposal."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: Barack Obama's plan calls for "mandates and fines for small businesses."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: John McCain "is proposing tax cuts that would give the average Fortune 500 CEO an additional $700,000 in tax cuts."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "Two years ago...I wrote to Secretary Paulson, I wrote to Federal Reserve Chairman Bernanke, and told them [subprime lending] is something we have to deal with."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: "Senator McCain has been talking tough about earmarks, and that's good, but earmarks account for about $18-billion of our budget."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "1.3-million people in America make their living off eBay."

author: By Adriel Bettelheim
title: "Senator Obama has voted 94 times to either increase your taxes or against tax cuts."

author: By Robert Farley
title: "Oil companies ...currently have 68-million acres that they're not using."

author: By Bill Adair
title: "I have disagreed strongly with the Bush administration on this issue" of global warming.

author: By Robert Farley
title: "Obama held one of the first meetings of his political career in Bill Ayers's home. And they've worked together on various projects in Chicago."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: McCain intervened on behalf of Charles Keating with federal regulators... that allowed Keating to continue his fraud at an incredible cost to taxpayers.

author: By Bill Adair
title: "John McCain voted against funding the troops because of . . . a timeline in it to draw down American troops."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: John McCain's health care plan "leaves you on your own to pay McCain’s health insurance tax."

author: By Robert Farley
title: "As mayor, every year I was in office I did reduce taxes."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "We're building a nearly $40-billion natural gas pipeline, which is North America's largest and most expensive infrastructure project ever."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "You had supported John McCain's military strategies pretty adamantly until this race."

author: By Robert Farley
title: Sen. McCain's tax plan provides "virtually nothing to the middle class."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: Barack Obama's health care plan is "to mandate health care coverage and have a universal government-run program."

author: By Bill Adair
title: John McCain said "he wouldn't even sit down with the government of Spain, a NATO ally that has troops in Afghanistan with us now."

author: By David DeCamp
title: "You ... said that Barack Obama was not ready to be commander in chief."

author: By David DeCamp
title: "Barack Obama ... 96 percent of his votes have been solely along party line."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "John McCain said...in December he was surprised there was a subprime mortgage problem."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "Obama, Biden and their liberal allies oppose clean coal."

author: By John Frank
title: Palin supports "aerial hunting of wolves and other wildlife."

author: By Adriel Bettelheim
title: "Under Barack Obama's plan, the government would spend $1-trillion more."

author: By John Frank
title: "Palin (proposed) a $150 bounty for the severed foreleg of each killed wolf."

author: By Bill Adair
title: Says McCain "voted to let governments charge rape victims" for forensic exams.

author: By Bill Adair
title: Says that under his tax plan, seniors making less than $50,000 per year won't pay any income taxes.

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "John McCain fought to rein in Fannie and Freddie...but Democrats blocked the reforms."

author: By Robert Farley
title: "There are so many loopholes ... our businesses pay effectively one of the lowest tax rates in the world."

author: By Robert Farley
title: "My plan offers three times as much tax relief to the middle class as Senator McCain's."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: Barack Obama "pays for every dime" of his spending plans.

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: John McCain "has threatened extinction for North Korea and sung songs about bombing Iran."

author: By Bill Adair
title: McCain "said the other day that he would not meet potentially with the prime minister of Spain, because he . . . wasn't sure whether they were aligned with us."

author: By Shawn Zeller
title: Henry Kissinger "said that we should meet with Iran — guess what — without precondition."

author: By Bill Adair
title: "The average South Korean is 3 inches taller than the average North Korean, a huge gulag."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: Under Obama's tax plan, "95 percent of you will get a tax cut."

author: By Angie Drobnic Holan
title: Obama "has voted in the United States Senate to increase taxes on people who make as low as $42,000 a year."

author: By Robert Farley
title: "You know, we spent $3-million to study the DNA of bears in Montana."

author: By Robert Farley
title: John McCain wants to "give oil companies another $4-billion" in tax breaks.

author: By Bill Adair
title: "Senator Obama has the most liberal voting record in the United States Senate."

author: By Robert Farley
title: "He has asked for $932-million of earmark pork-barrel spending, nearly a million dollars for every day that he’s been in the United States Senate."

author: By Alexander Lane
title: "President Eisenhower, on the night before the Normandy invasion...[wrote a] letter of resignation to the United States Army for the failure of the landings at Normandy."

author: By Shawn Zeller
title: House Republicans "weren't part of the negotiations" on the Wall Street bailout plan.
